body_html:
@ilaripih It seems that the latest tensorflow.bzl is the same as the qbx2@f2f9322 you just comment. But I still can't use the opencv(c++) read images.
Here is my BUILD:

cc_binary(
name = 'opencv_test',
srcs = ["loader.cc"],
linkopts = ["-lopencv_core","-lopencv_imgproc", "-lopencv_highgui"],
copts = ["-I/usr/include/"],
deps = [
  "//tensorflow/cc:cc_ops",
  "//tensorflow/core:framework_internal",
  "//tensorflow/core:tensorflow",
]
)

Did I miss something?Can you give an example of using the opencv and tensorflow simultaneous? Any advice would be grateful.

body:
@ilaripih It seems that the latest [tensorflow.bzl](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/tensorflow.bzl) is the same as the [qbx2@f2f9322 ](https://github.com/qbx2/tensorflow/commit/f2f9322db34d0d500bff2d7ac812c2daf53d4d79) you just comment. But I still can't use the opencv(c++) read images. 
Here is my BUILD:

```
cc_binary(
name = 'opencv_test',
srcs = ["loader.cc"],
linkopts = ["-lopencv_core","-lopencv_imgproc", "-lopencv_highgui"],
copts = ["-I/usr/include/"],
deps = [
  "//tensorflow/cc:cc_ops",
  "//tensorflow/core:framework_internal",
  "//tensorflow/core:tensorflow",
]
)
```

Did I miss something?Can you give an example of using the `opencv` and `tensorflow` simultaneous? Any advice would be grateful.
